context: The Estonian word 'kõiges' is an adessive case form of the pronoun 'kõik', which means 'all' or 'everything'. The '-es' ending indicates the adessive case, which typically shows location, state, or instrument. In this context, 'kõiges' translates to English as 'in everything' or 'in all things'. It's used when something exists in or relates to every possible thing or situation.
